publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-6463 Willie Coffey: Reel Journeys—That the Parliament congratulates Nicole Crawley and Calhi Young of James Hamilton Academy, Kilmarnock, on winning first place in Reel Journeys, the Scotland-wide film competition organised by Sustrans, the sustainable transport charity; notes that Nicole and Calhi’s winning entry was a three-minute film depicting typical journeys to school and how the trips could be made greener, cleaner and more enjoyable, and welcomes the competition as a means of helping participants understand their transport options and the pollution and health impacts of different modes of travel.
S3M-6463 Reel Journeys (lodged on 1 June 2010) Jamie Hepburn*, Sandra White*
S3M-6463 Reel Journeys (lodged on 1 June 2010) Christina McKelvie*, Kenneth Gibson*, Aileen Campbell*, Brian Adam*, Jim Hume*, Rob Gibson*

S3M-6463 Willie Coffey: Reel Journeys—That the Parliament congratulates Nicole Crawley and Calhi Young of James Hamilton Academy, Kilmarnock, on winning first place in Reel Journeys, the Scotland-wide film competition organised by Sustrans, the sustainable transport charity; notes that Nicole and Calhi’s winning entry was a three-minute film depicting typical journeys to school and how the trips could be made greener, cleaner and more enjoyable, and welcomes the competition as a means of helping participants understand their transport options and the pollution and health impacts of different modes of travel. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Sandra White, Christina McKelvie, Kenneth Gibson, Aileen Campbell, Brian Adam, Jim Hume, Rob Gibson
S3M-6463 Reel Journeys (lodged on 1 June 2010) Gil Paterson*, Linda Fabiani*
